Subjective: Headache for 2 months, worsening. Right side > bilateral. Occasional nausea, no vomiting. Light sensitivity. No flashes. Paracetamol tried, some relief with ibuprofen. Family history: father migraines, grandfather cluster headaches. No tumors. No recent stress. No coffee, energy drinks. Alcohol: 2-3 beers occasionally. No smoking/drugs. Impact: prefers dark room, difficulty socializing.
Objective: BP 120/80. Pulse 50/min. Neurological exam: Cranial nerves normal. Finger-nose test normal. Arm/leg strength normal. Romberg's normal. Walking straight line slightly off.
Assessment: Suspected migraine. Unlikely cluster headache. No signs of serious underlying cause.
Plan: Take paracetamol 4x2 as soon as symptoms start, add ibuprofen if needed
Keep a headache diary to identify triggers/worsening factors
Follow-up in 4 weeks, sooner if worse or changes
